entries.desc: Bind one or two handlers to the matched elements, to be executed when the mouse pointer enters and leaves the elements.

entry.name: hover
entry.title: .hover()
entry.desc: Bind two handlers to the matched elements, to be executed when the mouse pointer enters and leaves the elements.

argument.name: handlerIn(eventObject)
argument.desc: A function to execute when the mouse pointer enters the element.

argument.name: handlerOut(eventObject)
argument.desc: A function to execute when the mouse pointer leaves the element.

longdesc.p: The .hover() method binds handlers for both mouseenter and mouseleave events. You can use it to simply apply behavior to an element during the time the mouse is within the element.

entry.name: hover
entry.desc: Bind a single handler to the matched elements, to be executed when the mouse pointer enters or leaves the elements.

argument.name: handlerInOut(eventObject)
argument.desc: A function to execute when the mouse pointer enters or leaves the element.

longdesc.p: The .hover() method, when passed a single function, will execute that handler for both mouseenter and mouseleave events. This allows the user to use jQuery's various toggle methods within the handler or to respond differently within the handler depending on the event.type.
See the discussions for .mouseenter() and .mouseleave() for more details.

example.desc: Slide the next sibling LI up or down on hover, and toggle a class.
